data.title: Pick your own toppings for a custom ice cream flavor
data.text: There are two choices for a base flavor:  vanilla and chocolate.  But, there are hundreds of combinations to add to the base.  The ice cream is creamy and dense.  But, be warned:  you pay for the custom ice cream...average price for an adult size (which is rather small) is $5.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
First time here. I got the vanilla with bananas. De-lic-ious. You start with either vanilla or chocolate then choose an ingredient to be mixed into ice cream. 
We went on a Friday night and it was packed! I recommend.

data.title: Just my opinion on this but.......
data.text: These cupcakes look so delicious you almost cant stand yourself until you have to have one.  That first bite will tell you if you like it or not.... for me it is the icing... I think it is terrible and not edible.  Others like it but for the price I don't think it is worth it.  Easy access with limited parking but there are parking decks in the area for the overflow.

data.title: Inefficiently Run, Old & Not that Clean
data.text:
After spending an enjoyable hour or so  at the Marietta Outdoor Art Festival, the midday heat beckoned to be broken with a cool ice cream cone. We were right near Sweetreats so the timing seemed perfect! 

    The place was crowded (always a good sign) and the menu was quite tempting with so many unique flavors to choose from. 

     The first counter we saw contained plates of unappealing pieces of fudge on an old, dirty peeling shelf. (See photos.) I then looked around and noticed the whole place appeared unkempt and not that clean. As a Southern Mama Bear, I immediately suggested to the family that we leave and find another ice cream shop, but I was outvoted. 😣 (I look around for their Health Code Score, but didn't see it posted.) 

     So we got on line. There were 5-6 teenagers behind the counter busy doing things like sorting cones and working the mixer, but only ONE of them was taking orders despite the crowd.

     My husband (who owns/runs a business - not ice cream related) commented that their service style was clearly inefficient and disorganized. He also remarked that the sight of the chaos 😨 stressed him out. "I'd never be able to sleep or even relax knowing that my business was being run by teenagers!" 

     Still, the family's desire to try their ice cream outweighed the negatives. The Flavors Selection was huge and they sounded so enticing: Thin Mint, Nutella Cheesecake, Banana Pudding - just to name a few. (We limited everyone to a single cup or cone, not wanting to take too much of a risk.) 

      The ice cream did taste exactly as described and was full of flavor. Nevertheless, we will NOT return. The cleanliness of the shop was a real concern. For a similar sweet treat in a bright, clean, well-run, reputable ice cream shop - I would choose Cold Stone over Sweetreats Marietta any day.

data.title: Definately a sweet treat!
data.text: Tiny little place that was very busy! The poor girls putting together the orders were working their tails off tonight! Ice cream was great. I had banana pudding and my husband had the chocolate peanut butter. Very smooth and creamy. I'd go back again!

data.title: Lots of yummy combinations!
data.text: Loved our icecream! First, you choose your base (chocolate, vanilla, or yogurt) and then you can choose from a wide variety of mixins. I chose vanilla with cinnamon and cookie dough mixed on and it was delicious! You can create whatever combination you want, so you can't go wrong and the staff is really friendly!

data.title: Great local shop.
data.text: We went twice. Both times, great service, friendly people. Your local ice cream parlor with a twist.  They only serve vanilla and chocolate. You custom mix ingredients to get a personalized ice cream flavor. Not like Cold Stone...they actually grind everything together. The Chocolate Amaretto almond is to die for.

data.title: not bad
data.text: small ice cream shop. it's not bad, but it's not great, either. mine really lacked taste. i got a caramel cheesecake mix & never came across even 1 cheesecake piece and caramel was only drizzled on top. much better ice cream/gelato places around, but they are open later than most.

data.title: Rude male with dog
data.text: The location of Sweetreats is perfect! Right on Marietta Square. Unfortunately, my family and I did not get to enjoy Sweetreats as when we opened the door of the establishment a tall white male petting a dog slammed the door shut on us. He yelled, "they are closed" although the sign on the door displaying the hours told us they were not closing for another half hour. We were dismayed, but the dog in the establishment may have dis-swayed us from eating there anyways. Either way, I am writing this review so the owner knows that customers were being turned away during business hours, probably so that this rude male could get his friend/ gf out of work early. Just sad.

data.title: Always a fun place for a treat
data.text: Love to stop here after a long bike ride. They have lots of add ins but we usually stick to vanilla with a single add in. I always get the kid cup which is just right for me. The ice cream is rich and creamy so no complaints. Fun to watch them make also.

data.title: wonderful experience
data.text: Our group found this place while on the best of Marietta tour.  They were great , the food was wonderful.

data.title: Great ice cream flavors
data.text: Yummy, the ice cream was perfect on a warm November night in Marietta after dinner...Glad they stay open late...Kids loved the flavorsQ

data.title: Best ice cream in town!
data.text: I love this place!  Great desserts.  This is a very simple place with a powerhouse of flavor.  If you are craving dessert, come here! You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Awesome Ice Cream
data.text:
Love this place. Have been there couple times and it's always really good.

I love how they blend flavors together in the machine for the softserve.

Very reasonably priced and lots of different options, always come back with the family.

data.title: Great treat
data.text: Stop in on the square in Marietta. Get a mix in and enjoy. Couldn't have been happier with my banana pudding cup! Took the edge off a hot afternoon. Old fashioned shop worth the visit!

data.title: The Great Espresso Storm!
data.text: The Espresso Storm is just sinful! Made with a shot of espresso, and your choice of vanilla or chocolate ice cream (I chose chocolate, it was favored moreso). They blend it with milk and you have a smooth creamy cafe drink!

data.title: Good ice cream, interesting approach
data.text:
I twist on ice cream.  They only have vanilla and chocolate.  You create flavors based on what you add in (candy, fruit, etc.).  They have a ton of options.  I wasn't very adventurous.  I got a shake with vanilla ice cream, a few chocolate chips and heavy on the peppermint.  I was trying to create a mint chocolate chip flavor.  I wasn't really very successful.  The mint wasn't near strong enough.  But, the shake was still good and the ice cream tasted very fresh.

Service was good and fast.

data.title: Very fresh very tasty
data.text: Large cup of ice cream is huge. Miller or chocolate add in what you want and they use a huge auger  to blend it up. Family ran and quality good. If your looking for a glitzy chain then go to steak and shake. This is better.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: This has been on the Square for some time now.  Always a great place to get really good ice cream.  Nice variety of flavors too.

data.title: Custom-blended ice cream - delicious & fun
data.text:
Definitely one of my favorite haunts in Marietta after a fun day dining and shopping on the historic square. This is a little store that has a mom & pop feel to it. Decorations are so-so but you get the feeling that it's not run by a corporation so if you like supporting local businesses, this is it. 

Ice cream & frozen yogurt: Great concept. Blend any combinations you want with a base of vanilla or chocolate. I love that they use real ingredients -- actual fruit, nuts, candies etc. The possibilities are endless! 

Other offerings: They also have smoothies, coffee, milkshakes, jelly beans. In other words, your kids might go crazy!

Atmosphere: Simple decorations. Could look better. Good for families though. I saw that a lot of kids love sitting at the kid-sized tables. 

Service: Most of the staff look like they are in high school but the few I met seem to love their job. They're always excite to share their own favorites if you ask them to recommend a flavor. People complain about the speed when it's really busy but they only have two machines and everything is custom-blended. I guess most people are just too spoiled by the fast food culture (then go somewhere else, really). 

My favorite combinations:
Vanilla + Maple Fudge + Pecans + Caramel
Chocolate + Brownies + Walnuts
Vanilla + Peanut Butter + Rice Krispies + Marshmallows
Vanilla + Oreos + Raspberries

Obviously, I've been there quite a bit.
